message.content: This question requires an understanding of the term "decomposition." Decomposition refers to the process of breaking down organic matter into simpler substances. Option (A) is the correct answer because decomposition typically occurs in lifeless life forms, such as dead plants and animals. Option (B) is incorrect because decomposition does not involve living creatures breaking down, but rather the breakdown of their remains after death. Option (C) is incorrect because metals do not undergo decomposition. Option (D) is also incorrect because plastics take a very long time to decompose, but they do not break down into simpler substances like organic matter does.

This question is based on understanding the concept of decomposition. Decomposition refers to the breakdown of organic matter into simpler forms of matter. It is a natural process that occurs when bacteria, fungi, and other organisms break down dead plants and animals. Therefore, option (A) is correct because decomposition involves the breakdown of lifeless life forms. Option (B) is incorrect because decomposition does not involve living creatures; it occurs after they have died. Option (C) and (D) are also incorrect because decomposition specifically refers to the breakdown of organic matter, not metals or plastics.

Options (B), (C), and (D) are all incorrect because they do not align with the definition of decomposition.
